item.title: Wesley add a quote by Judith Butler
item.description: "Let's face it. We're undone by each other. And if we're not, we're missing something. If this seems so clearly the case with grief, it is only because it was already the case with desire. One does not always stay intact." -- Judith Butler

item.title: Wesley add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Wesley add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "The underlying foundation of life in New England was one of profound, unutterable, and therefore unuttered, melancholy, which regarded human existence itself as a ghastly risk, and, in the case of the vast majority of human beings, an inconceivable misfortune." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe
